tool.name: poaRowEnds
tool.displayname: Derive POA at Row Ends from Piles

param.name: rowsInput
param.dialogReference: Feature class polygon that defines the rows. Rows must be individual features within the feature class and have a unique identifier field

param.name: row_ID
param.dialogReference: Field in the Tracker rows feature class that provides a unique value (string or integer) for each row.

param.name: pilesInput
param.dialogReference: Point layer that defines the piles in each row with a matching row ID field to Tracker rows

param.name: poaField
param.dialogReference: Field in the pile feature class that designates the top of pile elevation

param.name: endofRowPt_out
param.displayname: Output end of row point feature class
param.dialogReference: A point feature class dataset that represents the extrapolated plane of array (from top of pile elevation)

tool.summary: Derives the plane of array at the end of rows as points from piles with a plane of array height field
tool.usage:
• Output is a point feature class that represents the elevation of the top of pile plane of array if extended to the ends of the row along the axis. The values do not represent the module height, which would depend on the tracker design. However, this can be used for checking to determine if the planes of array are separated too much and/or north-south shading may occur.

This tool is most useful to check grading areas and designed planes of array.

idCitation.resTitle: Derive POA at Row Ends from Piles
